alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Knox (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 3:23AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Knox and western Cedar Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 322 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles northwest of Fordyce, or 10 miles south of Yankton, moving northeast at 60 mph. Other storms were over western Cedar county from west of Hartington to east of Magnet, also moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... South Yankton and St. Helena around 330 AM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
